thread.title: South-east Queensland braces for record heatwave temps
thread.title_full: South-east Queensland braces for record heatwave temps

title: South-east Queensland braces for record heatwave temps
text:
"You're putting us, firies and the SES at risk if we have to rescue you in these extreme condition," it read. 
Assistant Commissioner Tom Dawson said extreme care was needed for activities like barbecues. 
"If people do not control their use of fire on the land in the south-east corner of Queensland, today is one of those potential days â€” it will run and escape," he said. 
He said even the smallest spark from angle grinders or cigarette butts could start a blaze. 
"People have got to apply total caution for what they're using fire for today," he said. 
"It'll simply take that discarded cigarette into that perfect, burnable condition and you've got a small fire which will go to a larger fire. 
"If there's any prevailing winds it will travel quite quickly in the direction of those winds." 
For those people living near bushland, he said it was a good time to refresh their fire plans. 
"Today's the day to revisit it, have a think about it and make sure every family member understands what needs to occur," he said. 
This morning there were nine fires burning around the state, but Mr Dawson said none posed a threat to people or properties.
